workflow.name: Set up complete MERN stack development environment on Linux server
workflow.description:
This automated n8n workflow sets up a complete MERN Stack development environment on a Linux server by installing core technologies, development tools, package managers, global npm packages, deployment tools, build tools, and security configurations. It creates a dedicated developer user and configures essential settings for MERN projects.

## What is MERN Stack Setup?
MERN Stack setup involves installing and configuring Node.js, MongoDB, Express.js, and React, along with additional tools and packages, to create a fully functional development environment for building MERN-based applications on a Linux system.

## Good to Know
- The workflow triggers manually and takes 10-15 minutes to complete
- A dedicated developer user with proper permissions is created
- Firewall configuration secures development ports
- The environment variables template is provided
- All tools are installed and ready for immediate use

## How It Works
- **Set Parameters** - Configures server host, user, password, setup type, Node.js version, MongoDB version, username, and user password
- **System Preparation** - Prepares the system for installation
- **Install Node.js** - Installs Node.js (v20 by default) with npm
- **Install MongoDB** - Installs MongoDB (v7.0 by default) with Compass & Shell
- **Install Git & GitHub CLI** - Installs Git and GitHub CLI
- **Install Development Tools** - Installs VS Code, Docker, Docker Compose, Postman, Nginx, Redis, and PostgreSQL
- **Create Dev User** - Creates a development user account
- **Install Additional Tools** - Installs package managers (npm, Yarn, pnpm), global npm packages, deployment tools, build tools, and security tools
- **Final Configuration** - Configures firewall, SSH keys, and environment variables template
- **Setup Complete** - Marks the completion of the setup process

## How to Use
- Import the workflow into n8n
- Configure parameters in the Set Parameters node (server_host, server_user, server_password, setup_type, node_version, mongodb_version, username, user_password)
- Run the workflow
- SSH into the server as the new developer user
- Start building MERN applications

## Requirements
- Linux server access with SSH
- Administrative privileges (root access)

## Customizing This Workflow
- Adjust the setup_type parameter to customize the installation scope
- Modify node_version or mongodb_version to use different versions
- Change the username and user_password for the developer account

workflow.name: Set Up Full MERN Stack Development Environment in 10 Seconds

parameters.command:
#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸš€ Starting MERN Stack Development Environment Setup..."
echo "YOUR_AWS_SECRET_KEY_HERE=============="

# Update system packages
echo "ðŸ“¦ Updating system packages..."
apt update -y && apt upgrade -y

# Install essential development tools
echo "ðŸ”§ Installing essential development tools..."
apt install -y curl wget git vim nano build-essential software-properties-common apt-transport-https ca-certificates gnupg lsb-release

# Install Python and pip (for some Node.js native modules)
apt install -y python3 python3-pip

# Install snapd for VS Code installation
apt install -y snapd

echo "âœ… System preparation completed!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ“± Installing Node.js and npm..."
echo "================================"

# Install Node.js using NodeSource repository
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_{{ $json.node_version }}.x | bash -
apt install -y nodejs

# Verify installation
echo "Node.js version: $(node --version)"
echo "npm version: $(npm --version)"

# Install global npm packages for MERN development
echo "ðŸ“¦ Installing global npm packages..."
npm install -g create-react-app
npm install -g @angular/cli
npm install -g express-generator
npm install -g nodemon
npm install -g pm2
npm install -g serve
npm install -g typescript
npm install -g ts-node
npm install -g @nestjs/cli
npm install -g next
npm install -g vite
npm install -g eslint
npm install -g prettier
npm install -g json-server
npm install -g http-server
npm install -g concurrently
npm install -g cross-env
npm install -g dotenv-cli

echo "âœ… Node.js and npm packages installed successfully!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸƒ Installing MongoDB..."
echo "========================"

# Import MongoDB GPG key
wget -qO - https://www.mongodb.org/static/pgp/server-{{ $json.mongodb_version }}.asc | apt-key add -

# Add MongoDB repository
echo "deb [ arch=amd64,arm64 ] https://repo.mongodb.org/apt/ubuntu $(lsb_release -cs)/mongodb-org/{{ $json.mongodb_version }} multiverse" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb-org-{{ $json.mongodb_version }}.list

# Update package list
apt update

# Install MongoDB
apt install -y mongodb-org

# Start and enable MongoDB
systemctl start mongod
systemctl enable mongod

# Install MongoDB Compass (GUI)
wget https://downloads.mongodb.com/compass/mongodb-compass_1.40.4_amd64.deb
dpkg -i mongodb-compass_1.40.4_amd64.deb
apt-get install -f -y

# Install MongoDB Shell (mongosh)
wget -qO - https://www.mongodb.org/static/pgp/server-{{ $json.mongodb_version }}.asc | apt-key add -
echo "deb [ arch=amd64,arm64 ] https://repo.mongodb.org/apt/ubuntu $(lsb_release -cs)/mongodb-org/{{ $json.mongodb_version }} multiverse" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb-org-{{ $json.mongodb_version }}.list
apt update
apt install -y mongodb-mongosh

# Verify MongoDB installation
echo "MongoDB version: $(mongod --version | head -n 1)"
echo "MongoDB Shell version: $(mongosh --version)"

echo "âœ… MongoDB installed and started successfully!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ™ Installing Git and Version Control Tools..."
echo "YOUR_AWS_SECRET_KEY_HERE====="

# Git is already installed in system preparation, but let's configure it
echo "Git version: $(git --version)"

# Install GitHub CLI
curl -fsSL https://cli.github.com/packages/githubcli-archive-keyring.gpg | dd of=/usr/share/keyrings/githubcli-archive-keyring.gpg
echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/githubcli-archive-keyring.gpg] https://cli.github.com/packages stable main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/github-cli.list > /dev/null
apt update
apt install -y gh

echo "GitHub CLI version: $(gh --version)"
echo "âœ… Git and version control tools installed successfully!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ’» Installing Development Tools and IDEs..."
echo "YOUR_AWS_SECRET_KEY_HERE=="

# Install Visual Studio Code
wget -qO- https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc | gpg --dearmor > packages.microsoft.gpg
install -o root -g root -m 644 packages.microsoft.gpg /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/
echo "deb [arch=amd64,arm64,armhf signed-by=/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/packages.microsoft.gpg] https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/code stable main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/vscode.list
apt update
apt install -y code

# Install Postman (API testing tool)
snap install postman

# Install Docker (for containerization)
apt install -y docker.io docker-compose
systemctl start docker
systemctl enable docker

# Install Nginx (web server)
apt install -y nginx
systemctl start nginx
systemctl enable nginx

# Install Redis (caching)
apt install -y redis-server
systemctl start redis-server
systemctl enable redis-server

# Install PostgreSQL (alternative database)
apt install -y postgresql postgresql-contrib
systemctl start postgresql
systemctl enable postgresql

echo "âœ… Development tools installed successfully!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ‘¤ Creating Development User Account..."
echo "======================================"

# Create a new user for development
useradd -m -s /bin/bash {{ $json.username }}
echo "{{ $json.username }}:{{ $json.user_password }}" | chpasswd

# Add user to sudo group
usermod -aG sudo {{ $json.username }}

# Add user to docker group
usermod -aG docker {{ $json.username }}

# Create development directories
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "mkdir -p ~/projects ~/websites ~/apis ~/mobile-apps"
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "mkdir -p ~/tools ~/scripts ~/backup"

# Set up SSH key for the user
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C '{{ $json.username }}@mern-dev' -N '' -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa"

# Configure Git for the user
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "git config --global user.name '{{ $json.username }}'"
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "git config --global user.email '{{ $json.username }}@example.com'"
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "git config --global init.defaultBranch main"

echo "âœ… Development user created successfully!"
echo "Username: {{ $json.username }}"
echo "Password: {{ $json.user_password }}"
echo "SSH Key: /home/{{ $json.username }}/.ssh/id_rsa.pub"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸš€ Installing Additional MERN Stack Tools..."
echo "YOUR_AWS_SECRET_KEY_HERE===="

# Install Yarn (alternative package manager)
npm install -g yarn

# Install pnpm (fast package manager)
npm install -g pnpm

# Install Heroku CLI (for deployment)
curl https://cli-assets.heroku.com/install.sh | sh

# Install Vercel CLI (for deployment)
npm install -g vercel

# Install Netlify CLI (for deployment)
npm install -g netlify-cli

# Install Firebase CLI (for deployment)
npm install -g firebase-tools

# Install AWS CLI (for deployment)
apt install -y awscli

# Install Google Cloud SDK
echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/cloud.google.gpg] https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt cloud-sdk main" | tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/google-cloud-sdk.list
curl https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt/doc/apt-key.gpg | apt-key --keyring /usr/share/keyrings/cloud.google.gpg add -
apt update
apt install -y google-cloud-cli

# Install additional development utilities
npm install -g @storybook/cli
npm install -g webpack webpack-cli
npm install -g parcel-bundler
npm install -g rollup
npm install -g gulp-cli
npm install -g grunt-cli
npm install -g lerna
npm install -g nx

echo "âœ… Additional MERN Stack tools installed successfully!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ”§ Final Configuration and Setup..."
echo "==================================="

# Configure firewall
ufw enable
ufw allow 22/tcp    # SSH
ufw allow 80/tcp    # HTTP
ufw allow 443/tcp   # HTTPS
ufw allow 3000/tcp  # React dev server
ufw allow 3001/tcp  # Express API
ufw allow 27017/tcp # MongoDB
ufw allow 5000/tcp  # Development server
ufw allow 8000/tcp  # Alternative dev server

# Set up environment variables template
cat > /home/{{ $json.username }}/.env.example << 'EOF'
# MongoDB Configuration
MONGO_URI=mongodb://user:user@example.com
EMAIL_PASS=your-app-password

# Cloud Storage (optional)
CLOUDINARY_CLOUD_NAME=your-cloud-name
CLOUDINARY_API_KEY=your-api-key
CLOUDINARY_API_SECRET=your-api-secret

# Payment Gateway (optional)
STRIPE_PUBLIC_KEY=your-stripe-public-key
STRIPE_SECRET_KEY=your-stripe-secret-key
EOF

# Create a sample MERN project structure
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "mkdir -p ~/projects/sample-mern-app/{client,server,database}"

# Create package.json for the root project
cat > /home/{{ $json.username }}/projects/sample-mern-app/package.json << 'EOF'
{
  "name": "sample-mern-app",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A sample MERN stack application",
  "main": "server/index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "concurrently \"npm run server\" \"npm run client\"",
    "server": "cd server && npm run dev",
    "client": "cd client && npm start",
    "build": "cd client && npm run build",
    "install-deps": "npm install && cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install"
  },
  "keywords": ["mern", "mongodb", "express", "react", "nodejs"],
  "author": "{{ $json.username }}",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "concurrently": "^8.2.2"
  }
}
EOF

# Change ownership of the project files
chown -R {{ $json.username }}:{{ $json.username }} /home/{{ $json.username }}/projects/

echo "âœ… Final configuration completed!"
echo "ðŸŽ‰ MERN Stack Development Environment Setup Complete!"
echo "YOUR_AWS_SECRET_KEY_HERE============"
echo "ðŸ“Š Installation Summary:"
echo "â€¢ Node.js version: $(node --version)"
echo "â€¢ npm version: $(npm --version)"
echo "â€¢ MongoDB: Installed and running"
echo "â€¢ Git: $(git --version)"
echo "â€¢ Docker: $(docker --version)"
echo "â€¢ VS Code: Installed"
echo "â€¢ Development User: {{ $json.username }}"
echo "â€¢ Project Directory: /home/{{ $json.username }}/projects/"
echo ""
echo "ðŸš€ Your MERN Stack development environment is ready!"
echo "Login as: {{ $json.username }}"
echo "Password: {{ $json.user_password }}"
echo "Happy coding! ðŸŽ¯"

string.name: setup_status
string.value: âœ… MERN Stack Development Environment Setup Complete!

string.name: installed_tools
string.value: Node.js, MongoDB, Git, Docker, VS Code, Postman, Nginx, Redis, PostgreSQL

string.name: next_steps
string.value: SSH into server, switch to dev user, and start building MERN applications!

Installs Node.js (v20 by default) with npm
Configures server host, user, password, setup type, Node.js version, MongoDB version, username, and user password

user.name: Oneclick AI Squad
user.bio: The AI Squad Initiative is a pioneering effort to build, automate and scale AI-powered workflows using n8n.io. Our mission is to help individuals and businesses integrate AI agents seamlessly into their daily operations  from automating tasks and enhancing productivity to creating innovative, intelligent solutions. We design modular, reusable AI workflow templates that empower creators, developers and teams to supercharge their automation with minimal effort and maximum impact.
